Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>### Input:John hated mosquitoes.  It wasn't the bloodsucking that he disliked, it was that the insects made what? Choices:  A: fly B: buzz C: move D: honey E: help flowers pollenate<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>A program should be coded that would accept the following values (3, 5, 9). Then it should print out that the sum of these numbers is 17.<n><n>- How are the values passed to the program? Choices:  (1) One at a time (2) By array (3) By a container list and  (4) By a container string<n><n>### Instructor's code  :<n><n>```<n>//This method should not be imported until we have coded the main class<n>private static void printResult(int[] array) {<n>    System.out.println(array[0] + " + " +<n>            array[1] + " + "  +<n>            array[2]  + " = " +<n>            (array[0]+ array[1]+ array[2])<n>    );<n>}<n><n><n>public static void main(String[] args) {<n>    int[] myArray = new int[3];<n>    <n>    int[] one = {1,2,3};<n>    printResult(one);<n>}<n>```<n><n><n>### User Input: (3, 5, 9)<n><n>```<n>3<n>5<n>9<n>```<n><n>```<n>1 + 2 + 3 = 6<n>```<n><n>### User's code.<n><n>```<n>public static void main (String[] args){<n>    int[] ar  = {1,2};<n>    printResult (ar);<n>}<n><n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>### Input:The family was playing cards, what would be a reason for this? Choices:  A: amusement B: losing money C: charmed D: having fun E: win money<n><n>### Response:		<n>> The family was playing cards because they wanted to charmed one and<n>have fun or win a money.<n><n>### Input :The scientist observed that the amount of sunrays absorbed by the planet depends on the albedo of the planet, what<n>was the difference? Choices:   A: the planet is too dark B: the planet is too white C: the planet is too young D: the planet is too old E: the planet is too hot<n><n>### Response<n>>The difference between the amount of sunlight absorbed depending on the albedo, that is if the albedo is 1.0% the amount of light that will be absorbed in a certain surface of the planet will be 20%. The sunlight was absorbed on every surface of Earth and the albedo was 10%; and when absorbed 90% of the amount of sunlight was reflected while only 10% was absorbed.<n><n>### The problem was how to get to Mumbai<n><n><n>### The next question was how to drive through India, the road map helped<n><n>### In this case the input was a country, the map and the desired route were the expected output

Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>### Input:The woman experienced great joy, but despite that this was a what? Choices:  A: misery B: sadness C: bad time D: sorrow E: play time<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices: A=D, B=E<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Input:This is the 1st time, she has had a lot of practice in driving and she is what? Choices: A: a beginner B: an expert C: experienced D: a novice E: a learner<n><n>## Instructions<n>Input:The man had heard about a what? Choices A: dog C: animal B: giraffe D: zebra E: horse<n><n>### Instuctions<n>Input:The boy got to work early and he what? Choices:A: had breakfast C: worked for the day B: got dinner D: worked<n><n>### Response<n>Choices: B=D, A=B, C=C<n><n>## Instrucs<n>Input:The woman asked about how to keep her skin in shape after using the lotion. The doctor what? Choices:	A: advised her to avoid the sun B: advised her to stay out of the sun	C: explained the ingredients of the lotion	D: advised her not to use the lotion any more E: encouraged her to use<n><n>### Response&Instructions<n>Choices: D =E<n><n>### Question 11<n>Input:The boy was very satisfied with the what? Choices: C: service A: product B: shop D: price E: quality<n><n>### Instruct<n>Input:The boy had been asked to pay half the what? Choices A= C B=A C=B E=D D=E<n><n>## Response and Question 12<n>Choices: E=D<n><n>### Instruption:input<n>The boy wanted to buy a jacket and was searching for a shop. He finally went to a good one, because it was? Choices: 	A: popular  C: well-known	B: famous D: big<n><n><n>### Input<n>When she returned home, she noticed the room and wondered if she liked the? Choices:  Choices:  A= D B= A, C, E<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>### Input:What would a person do if he or she wanted to get good grades? Choices:  A: feel proud B: try to learn C: need assistance D: thank god E: read alot<n><n>### Response:		 A: try to learn<n><n>### Input:"I just can't figure out how to do that". What could this person do? Choices: <n><n>### Response:"Try and search online for help with that". Then, wait for a response from the website, text or phone.<n><n>### Input:'When is lab over'? What might a person want to know? Choices: A:  time B:  results C:  test D:  question E:  date<n><n>### Response:'I am sorry I don't know'.<n><n>#### How to use these codes<n><table><n>  <tr><n>    <th>Command</th><n>    <th colspan="2">Description</th><n>  </tr>  <n>  <tr> <td> <code! > </code></td> <td> Execute command when question is asked</td> <td> &nbsp; </td>  </tr><n>  <tr > <td><code!: "</code></td> <th>Input</th> <td><code > </code> </td><n>    <td>(Input)</td>  <th></td>  </tr ><n>   <tr> <td><code!| : " </code></td>  <td><code ></code> </td> <td><code |.<n>    <code >" </code> </td></tr> <tr><n>  <td><code?</code></td><n>  <td>(Yes/No)</td></td<td> </td><n>  <tr><td><code? |:</code> </td></td></tr><n>  <tbody></table><n><n>### Task Complete:<n><input type="checkbox" value="."> <label for=".">Yes</label><n><n>### Inputs and Outputs<n>Inputs: <input type="checkbox" id="input1"> <label for="input1">Input 1 here...</label></input> <n><n>Inputs:<input type="checkbox"> <label for="">Input 2 here!</label></input><n><n>Outputs<n>: <input type="output" value="Output 1 here!"></input><n><n>### Outputs<n>: <input-output-container><n><n>### Other C

Choices:  A: factory B: school C: grocery store D: band E: aircraft<n><n>### Response:		If someone asks you to do something for them like, write me a book. You must ask what kind of book they want you to write. Also, you have multiple ways to write a sentence. If someone asks for 2500 copies, there are 2500 different ways to write 2500.<n><n>### Example: If someone ask you to change the color of my kitchen, you may not change the light fixtures, flooring, paint, walls, wallpaper, ceiling, cabinet, appliances, recessed lighting, door, countertop, and ceiling fan.<n><n>### Avoid:<n>Writing the same sentence again and again to fill every blank in the code.<n><n>### Good Example:<n><n>### Expected Output<n>If you have multiple choices that the user can pick from, always provide feedback to the user if their choice of 'choice' is correct or not.<n><n>The code must be clean and scalable. The code should look professional and easy to review, edit, and maintain.<n><n>**Reminder:** Be sure to read the documentations and review other examples, before you start. Your best teacher is [google](https://www.google.com?src=bo&gbih=800&gbiv=1&biw=1920&bih=951&tbm=isch&sa=1&q=how+to%7C%20code%7C%2#q=google) or [wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org)

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>### Input:Learning usually leads to greater what? Choices:  A: get to know B: gain knowledge C: intelligence D: education E: gaining knowledge<n><n>### Response:		<n>D:\python\coding4fun>python.exe answer.py<n>D:\python\python\coding4Fun>C:\Python36-Windows-x86\python.exe answer.ex<n>\$\$\$\$\$\$\$<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Answer.py<n><n>```py<n>#Demonsration<n>#Input: The lab results compiled, scientists began analyzing the data because he wants what?<n># Answer: the data so he can get enlightening the future<n># Demonstration<n>#Input: Learning usually leads to greater what<n>#Answer: intelligence<n>```<n><n>Answer.ex<n><n>```py<n><n>import re<n>myFile = open("D:\python\cpython\coding4FUn\MyCoding.txt","r")<n><n># Find All The String By Input<n>myString = myFile.read()<n>dataString = re.search(r"what", myString) <n><n># Check If The String Exist<n># if dataString!= None: return myString<n>#     else: return ""<n><n># Output <n>print(dataString)<n>if dataString:<n>    return dataString.group(0)<n><n># Input: The lab results had be compiled, the scientist begun analyzing the data because<n># he wanted what?<n>print(re.search(r"to enlightened", myFile.read).group())<n><n>#Input: Learning, usually leads to greater what.<n><n>#return dataString.group(1)<n><n><n># input<n>myString = "Learning usually leads"<n>dataString1 = re.search(re.IGNORECASE + "\s(.+?)\sfor", myString)<n>dataString2 = re.search( re.IGNORECASE, myString )<n>print(dataString1.group(0))<n>print(dataString2.group(0)) # print what are the keywords<n><n># Output<n>Learning, usually leads for greater<n>\$\$\$\$

Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>### Input:What is a person likely to feel when they are abandoned by everyone after they stop being married to someone else? Choices:  A: grief B: solo C: isolation D: pleasure E: happiness<n><n>### Response:		<n>What is a person likely feel after being abandoned by their former partner can be different according to many factors one can be they do not have friends close to them,another is that they don't have any money to get to their house, the question does not tell us exactly why someone may feel this because we were not given any information about the person and his friends, the other reasons that we get from the question is that he may feel abandoned because he may have lost his job that enabled him to buy the house,so he does not rent it because he does not have the money to pay for it, I think that some of the possible reasons that someone may feel like this is not the only one it's just some that I can think of maybe there is others.<n><n>### Comments:<n>- First, I'm worried that we're not going to receive enough specifics to write our answers. We're going to need to make judgements that will affect the answers.<n>- I also think that the questions will be very tricky. They are in a way. "What is a person likely think..." I'm worried if we don't have the right answer to what's going to happen, we're going to be wrong. I think it could be possible to answer correctly to the question, but the answer may contradict what was going to happen in the next question.<n><n>## Reflection<n>I found that this course is a little different from the last few ones we have taken but still we can use the previous ones when we think we need help. It's important to not give the exact answer but try to explain the best answer you can.<n>The one thing that surprised me in this course is how it can be different from some other online courses, it's better than some.I think it's better to talk about every question or information we need to get help from someone or try to solve it with the information we received. It also depends on what we have been given.<n><n>### Constructive feedback for peers<n><n>- In response to the second question, it's important to find the reason for why someone may feel the way they do<n>- It's also important to give examples to strengthen the answer<n>- To the last question it's equally important to do this, give examples as well as explain what they are<n><n>### Conclusion<n>In conclusion there are many benefits to learning with

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>### Input:When going to sleep what noise does a human make? Choices:  A: loss of consciousness B: relaxation C: snoring D: dreaming E: talking<n><n>### Response:		A, and B.<n><n>Cross validation for this question will be to create a function to answer, and then for every function created call your function and compare the results to the answer. If your result is the same as the answer you win.<n><n>## Problem:<n>### How do you compare and answer a question<n><n>### The task is to create a function that will test you.<n><n>### You are given the same task as me that I have to answer.<n><n>### And at the end of each test you will be able to see your final score.<n><n>### So you have to answer the questions like me and call your functions the same names as their functions.<n>#### Expected answers<n><n>### The test will go as follows:<n>    - The first question will be randomised every time.<n>    - Once you answer a question you can not change your answer.<n>    - Once the answer has been given by you the next question will be displayed.<n>    - Once all the questions have passed you will be able to add your name and will be given the result (the result is the final score you have obtained).<n><n>### The questions will be:<n>    - Demonstration and Expected Answers of the answers are given.<n>    - The same question will be asked to you which will have the option to be passed, if it is.<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>### Input:Why would I want to be exercising? Choices:  A: fatigue B: relaxation C: tiredness D: muscle weakness E: losing weight<n><n>### Response:		Exercising strengthens the heart, reduces fatigue and anxiety and prevents obesity and blood vessel disease. It also boosts your immune system and helps control your weight.<n><n>### Input<n>Do my family enjoy me cooking?<n><n>### Response<n>Yes.<n><n>### Response2<n>Because you gave me that great recipe.<n><n>### Dexterity<n><n>```<n>import { List, Map } from 'immutable'<n><n>const sample = new Immutable.Map({<n>  foodName: 'Chicken',<n>  ingredients: new Immutable.List(['onions','salt', 'pepper', 'chicken']),<n>  category: 'Main',<n>  price: new Immutable.Map().set('salt', '20'),<n>});<n><n>// this works<n>sample.toJS()<n>.get('ingredients', 'price')<n>.set('salt', 20.00)<n>```<n><n>### Task<n>```javascript<n>import { List } from 'immutable';<n><n>const ingredientsMap = new Immutable.fromJS({<n>  foodName:'Spaghetti',<n>  ingredient: new List(['red wine', 'chocolate', 'tomato sauce']),<n>  category:'Dessert',<n>  price:new Immutable.fromJS(20),<n>});<n><n>// the chocolate ingredient should be at index 1<n><n>// so the change should be 1, 2<n><n>const change = ingredientsMap.get('ingredient').push(2, 3);<n><n>ingredientsMap.setIn(['ingredient', '2', '3'], change, ingredientsMap);<n><n>ingredientMap<n> .toJS()<n> .get('ingredient', 'price')<n> .set('chocolate', 2.00)<n> .set('2', 3.00)<n><n>ingredientList<n> .toJS(ingredientMap)<n> .get('2')<n> .setIn(['tomato sauce', 'value'],'red', ingredientList)<n> .setIn(ingredientList.get('2', 'value'), '3', ingredientList);<n>```<n><n>
